intro: Pseudocymopterus filicinus, commonly known as the fern-like liverwort, is a type of bryophyte belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its intricate, fern-like thallus structure, which is typically divided into leaf-like lobes. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found on rocks or tree trunks in temperate regions. Its reproductive structures, called capsules, contain spores that are dispersed by wind. Pseudocymopterus filicinus plays an important ecological role in nutrient cycling and soil stabilization in its habitat.
